Caption: Fig. 1. The genealogy of Greek Gods depicted by GeneaQuilts (rotated 45o for better layout in this paper). Each F icon represents a nuclear family composed of parents (black dots above the icon) and children (black dots below).
Fig. 2. European Royal families (same as that of Fig. 4) depicted by a standard Node-Link representation using the “dot” program to compute the layout [10]. Notice long edges and crossings.
Fig. 3. A node-link depiction of a small layered graph (left) and its quilt depiction (right) [38].
Fig. 5. GeneaQuilts Visualization of the Simpson Family.
Fig. 4. The GeneaQuilts System showing part of the European Royal families. It consists of (a) the main visualization, (b) an overview, (c) a timeline and (d) a query and details panel.
Fig. 7. Bring & Slide from Henry IV to his son Louis XIII in the European Royal Family genealogy. The full path can be seen in Fig. 4.
Fig. 7. Bring & Slide from Henry IV to his son Louis XIII in the European Royal Family genealogy. The full path can be seen in Fig. 4.
Fig. 9. Lot and his descendants from the Book of Genesis.
Fig. 8. Animation (a) of ﬁltering using DOI, (b) focused on a selected bloodline (red) and search results (blue).
Fig. 10. Henry VIII and his Wives.
Fig. 11. Evolution of land ownership in a 15th century family.
